snippet.textDisplay: Hey friends! Life isn’t normal for anybody right now, but we’re doing our best to upload regular content for our community of fans and friends. That means we’ll be editing as much as we can from the videos we shot before we went on quarantine--and pushing ourselves to make some fun new things to keep you company, wherever you are. We love you guys!
snippet.textOriginal: Hey friends! Life isn’t normal for anybody right now, but we’re doing our best to upload regular content for our community of fans and friends. That means we’ll be editing as much as we can from the videos we shot before we went on quarantine--and pushing ourselves to make some fun new things to keep you company, wherever you are. We love you guys!

snippet.textDisplay: I don't understand the white people saying they're racist cuz they're white...no honey that's not how it works!! There's 100% a difference between admitting you have white privilege, being thankful you are white, acknowledging the struggles of other races, but just because of the color of you're skin you're not "racist"!!!! That to me in and of itself is a racist thing to say towards yourself! Like what!?if you love and accept other races and are kind toward them and treat them as equals and think they deserve kindness and the same rights and treatment as you, and stand up for people of other races when they are being marginalized/bullied/treated poorly, then...why are you calling yourself racist?

snippet.textDisplay: Soooo....everyone’s racist?
snippet.textOriginal: Soooo....everyone’s racist?

snippet.textDisplay:
Anyone talking about "races" is a racist.
There are no races. None of the features like different colours of skin or differently shaped eyes are more than just variations within our species.
Think of it this way: wolves come in all sorts of colours... white, brown, black, grey... do you think those are all different species?

"Race" is an entirely made up concept. It does not exist. Believing that races of humans exist is like believing in the tooth fairy.
snippet.textOriginal:
Anyone talking about "races" is a racist.
There are no races. None of the features like different colours of skin or differently shaped eyes are more than just variations within our species. 
Think of it this way: wolves come in all sorts of colours... white, brown, black, grey... do you think those are all different species?

"Race" is an entirely made up concept. It does not exist. Believing that races of humans exist is like believing in the tooth fairy.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm a black person living in a majority Asian community now. One of my very good and recent friends is Asian. I was very hesitant about the whole situation hearing the stories of how racist Asians can be toward black people. I currently find my experience great, having yet to find anyone that has outwardly expressed discrimination/prejudice. However, I do get the occasional old Asian lady staring into my soul as I simply shop for groceries. Like, ma'am what is your problem?

If you're Asian or anyone for that matter, and aware of people in your family that are prejudice or racist please call them out on it. I do the same when my parents/family say shit that's out of line.
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm a black person living in a majority Asian community now. One of my very good and recent friends is Asian. I was very hesitant about the whole situation hearing the stories of how racist Asians can be toward black people. I currently find my experience great, having yet to find anyone that has outwardly expressed discrimination/prejudice. However, I do get the occasional old Asian lady staring into my soul as I simply shop for groceries. Like, ma'am what is your problem? 

If you're Asian or anyone for that matter, and aware of people in your family that are prejudice or racist please call them out on it. I do the same when my parents/family say shit that's out of line.

snippet.textDisplay: “everyone is racist” “black people cant be racist” “i’m racist because i’m white” what has our word come to? 1. no, not everyone is racist. i love everyone equally, it doesn’t matter where you come from or what your skin color is, all that matters is the way you act and your personality. 2. black people can be racist. now dont get me wrong, not all black people are racist, just some. i’ve seen some that are racist to their own skin color because they don’t like it. 3. just because you’re white doesn’t mean you should be racist or it gives you the right to say racist things about others. hispanics, asians, blacks, muslims, etc are all human. we all come from different places and have different skin colors, but that doesn’t mean we should get any less respect than others. we’re all human and have feelings, so think before you try to say something about where someone comes from or what their skin color is. 💙
snippet.textOriginal: “everyone is racist” “black people cant be racist” “i’m racist because i’m white” what has our word come to? 1. no, not everyone is racist. i love everyone equally, it doesn’t matter where you come from or what your skin color is, all that matters is the way you act and your personality. 2. black people can be racist. now dont get me wrong, not all black people are racist, just some. i’ve seen some that are racist to their own skin color because they don’t like it. 3. just because you’re white doesn’t mean you should be racist or it gives you the right to say racist things about others. hispanics, asians, blacks, muslims, etc are all human. we all come from different places and have different skin colors, but that doesn’t mean we should get any less respect than others. we’re all human and have feelings, so think before you try to say something about where someone comes from or what their skin color is. 💙

snippet.textDisplay: Stop arguing about "black people can't be racist". The question itself is a bait and switch and it hinges on your favorite definition of "racism". If you mean institutionalized racism, then the individual component is not your focal point hence "all white people are racist towards other groups", and the word racIST is fundamentally uninteresting. If you mean general prejudice based on race, then obviously everyone can have it and has it to an extent. See it's just semantics.
snippet.textOriginal: Stop arguing about "black people can't be racist". The question itself is a bait and switch and it hinges on your favorite definition of "racism". If you mean institutionalized racism, then the individual component is not your focal point hence "all white people are racist towards other groups", and the word racIST is fundamentally uninteresting. If you mean general prejudice based on race, then obviously everyone can have it and has it to an extent. See it's just semantics.

snippet.textDisplay: I’m not usually one to comment on YouTube videos but I this was such a good episode!! I think it actually brought up some really important points and there was actual discussion (in a way). Also, I’m surprised no one brought up internalized racism at all; that would be the one point that I think would have made statements a bit more accurate.

snippet.textDisplay: Anyone can be racist, but yes institutionalized racism is a thing, and is typically established by the majority of a settlement, in the US it just so happens that white people have the most power, but just because our founding fathers were racist, that doesn’t make all white people racist or mean that other races can’t be racist.
snippet.textOriginal: Anyone can be racist, but yes institutionalized racism is a thing, and is typically established by the majority of a settlement, in the US it just so happens that white people have the most power, but just because our founding fathers were racist, that doesn’t make all white people racist or mean that other races can’t be racist.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think Black people can be racist too, towards other people of color, (Asian, Native, Hispanic, and so on) but the person's explanation on why they couldn't be honestly makes sense.
Also, yup, all white people are racist. Sometimes not because you're a bad person, but because you grew up in a society with lots of bias and you need to unlearn them. There's nothing wrong with aknowledging that, if you deny it... you got a lot of work to do, folk. The first step is to accept it, and then work on it. Listen to BIPOCs!
snippet.textOriginal:

There's nothing wrong with aknowledging that, if you deny it... you got a lot of work to do, folk. The first step is to accept it, and then work on it. Listen to BIPOCs!
